episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features facts about the etymology of the word 'thing' and its connection to parliaments, a rhinoceros that received a large number of votes in a Brazilian election, Finland's unique use of saunas for political decisions, and instances of candidates receiving zero votes in British elections.

facts.fact: The first thing called a thing was a parliament.
One of the largest majorities in a Brazilian local election was won by a rhino.
Finland's parliament sometimes makes decisions in their sauna.
In British electoral history, eight candidates have been awarded no votes at all in a general election.
